item.title: ChatRPA
item.description:
ğŸ¤– ChatRPA: Empowering Automation with AI + RPA

ğŸ“Œ Project Overview

ChatRPA is an intelligent automation assistant that combines the natural language power of ChatGPT with the operational efficiency of RPA (Robotic Process Automation). It enables usersâ€”whether individuals or enterprisesâ€”to describe their task needs in natural language, and have RPA bots automatically execute them.

ğŸ§  Key Technologies

Function Technology
Prompt Parsing ChatGPT / OpenAI
Instruction Mapping Prompt Engineering
Task Execution Custom RPA Components (search, type, watch, select, load)
Orchestration DAG Scheduler + Go backend
Interface Interactive chat with GPT

ğŸ”„ Usage Workflow

  1. User describes task via chat
  2. ChatGPT interprets & decomposes steps
  3. Steps are mapped to programmatic instructions
  4. RPA components are dynamically composed
  5. RPA executes task & returns result to user

ğŸ” Users can revise and re-run the steps until satisfied.
â˜ï¸ All workflows are saved in the cloud for future reuse.

ğŸ’¡ Application Scenarios

ğŸ¢ Enterprise Use Case â€“ Bank Monitoring Stock Dividends

  • Automatically extracts dividend announcements from stock exchange sites
  • Classifies by region/branch
  • Emails branch-specific files to account managers

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ”¬ Personal Use Case â€“ Academic Researcher

  • Pulls provincial newspaper reports about specific companies from WiseSearch
  • Downloads thousands of PDFs by date range
  • Runs headless with long-time automation

ğŸš€ Product Value

  • âœ… No-Code Interface â€” Chat-based task input lowers barrier for non-tech users
  • âœ… Modular Automation â€” RPA components can be reused & recombined
  • âœ… Business-Grade Precision â€” Prompts guide GPT to output correct flows
  • âœ… Enterprise & Personal Modes â€” Scales from individual use to SaaS platforms

ğŸ’° Cost Analysis

  • Initial development cost ~Â¥50,000
  • Runtime cost per week ~Â¥1123 (Cloud + API usage)
  • Expansion cost per new RPA module ~Â¥7000+

ğŸ’¼ Monetization Strategy

  • B2B SaaS: Custom platform + tailored modules for enterprises
  • B2C Subscription: Ready-to-use modules for automation enthusiasts
  • Marketplace: Share/sell user-created automation modules

âš ï¸ Risk Considerations

  • Technical: Integration stability and prompt precision
  • Compliance: Data privacy concerns with API and third-party access
  • Mitigation: Anonymization, encryption, and potential for domestic AI substitution
